been particularly contentious in the wireless industry, which has argued that it needs the freedom to manage networks because bandwidth is limited and consumers could experience slower access or dropped service if some applications hog capacity. Opening wireless services to greater consumer choice will drive investment and innovation in the mobile marketplace, Julius Genachowski said in a statement Tuesday.
